Article.ArticleTitle: Ozonation of polyoxymethylene effluent in a rotating packed bed.

AbstractText: This work aimed to investigate the effectiveness of ozone in degradation of polyoxymethylene (POM) effluent in a rotating packed bed (RPB) (O<sub>3</sub>-RPB system). The degradation efficiency was evaluated in terms of chemical oxygen demand (COD), 5-day biological oxygen demand (BOD<sub>5</sub>) and BOD<sub>5</sub>/COD under various operating conditions. Pilot experiments comprising the O<sub>3</sub>-RPB unit coupled with a biological contact oxidation unit were also carried out. The COD removal rates in the pilot process increased markedly to about 70-85% compared to about 40% in the original treatment process, which is the tertiary aerobic treatment in the plant, confirming that the O<sub>3</sub>-RPB system is very efficient in improving the biodegradability of the POM effluent.
